guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
Hmm I don’t think I normally imagine Him with a face or expression, but I do joke with Him sometimes and think He might be humorous back. Like a kid who is a little cheeky with their dad and dad is a little exasperated but is still delighted by the interaction. I believe God has a sense of humor, for laughter is good and all good things are a reflection of God’s nature. 

Watching this show gave an interesting perspective on what Jesus’ character might be like in context: https://youtu.be/K1-FoFj8Jbo

Though I’ve always thought the portrayal in the Passion of Christ would be more accurate, because there’s this mysterious and self controlled sense there that I think Jesus would have. 

I have a hard time imagining what it might be like when I meet God, because we are allowed to approach Him personally and intimately as a friend, but I also think there will be this incredible awe that comes when we truly understand who we’ve been talking to.
body_html:
Hmm I don’t think I normally imagine Him with a face or expression, but I do joke with Him sometimes and think He might be humorous back. Like a kid who is a little cheeky with their dad and dad is a little exasperated but is still delighted by the interaction. I believe God has a sense of humor, for laughter is good and all good things are a reflection of God’s nature.

Watching this show gave an interesting perspective on what Jesus’ character might be like in context: https://youtu.be/K1-FoFj8Jbo

Though I’ve always thought the portrayal in the Passion of Christ would be more accurate, because there’s this mysterious and self controlled sense there that I think Jesus would have.

I have a hard time imagining what it might be like when I meet God, because we are allowed to approach Him personally and intimately as a friend, but I also think there will be this incredible awe that comes when we truly understand who we’ve been talking to.
